text: Dark pour at the Jeffrey. Nose is dry roasted malt and some earth. Tastes of lovely roasted malt, some earth, light cola and cocoa. Dry finish. Pretty good

Marrom escuro turva, espuma marrom claro de abundante formação e boa persistência. Aroma adocicado, seca, achocolatada e leve café. No paladar médio amargor torrado, leve dulçor. Corpo leve e média carbonatação. Final seco entrega parte do lúpulo que remete a origem inglesa. Carece de impacto mas tem boa drinkability.

Nearly black pour with a thin light tan head. Dark chocolate, slight coffee, a little smoke and red fruit on the nose. Taste is similar - smoky, chocolate and coffee, a little cherry, fairly creamy with a dry finish

Bouteille de 375 ml. Couleur noire avec un joli col foncé. Arôme de chocolat, de café et de houblon fleural. Goût de café, de pain grillé et de fleur. La finale est sèche et agréable. En gros, cest une bonne bière.
The beer has got a deep black colour with a big head and medium body. Aroma of malt and chocolate. Taste of malt, dark bread, hops, chocolate and coffee. Dry and malty finish.

UPDATED: DEC 30, 2016 Bue à la pression. Couleur noire intense, mousse beige qui a de l?endurance, nez qui semble être sur le whisky de prime abord. Ça se remet à mousser en bouche avec des notes de moka/praline, puis chocolat en fin de bouche. Pas mon genre, moi qui n?aime pas le café, mais ça passe.

Aroma of coffee and roasted malt. Appearance is a blackish brown with a huge tan head that retains exceptionally well. Taste is coffee, chocolate, brown sugar, earth. Palate is medium-thin with a dry and roasty finish. Overall- Well balanced and quite drinkable.

Bouteille. Bière noire opaque surmontée dune épaisse mousse moka assez touffue qui tient bien la route. Au nez elle offre des arômes de café, de chocolat noir et de grains torréfiés avec une légère touche fruitée avec cassonade. En bouche les mêmes saveurs sont présentes avec une amertume modérée en finale et un corps léger mais légèrement crémeux.
Klares dunkles rotbraun mit durchschnittlicher Schaumkrone. Röstmalzig, etwas Kaffee, Mokka, dunkle Schokolade, etwas Vanille, leicht würzig.

dark brown, almost black colour, moderate sized beige-ish head; aroma of cocoa powder, dark chocolate, ash, some dried plum and sour cherry, as well as peated notes; taste is the same with considerably less intensity; a bit watery, which is fully acceptable taking into account that it is "only" a dry stout

0,375l bottle at home bought from Firmabier (I think). Bottle says 130215, which I guess means bottled on. There was another label on the bottle which seems to have been torn off. black color, medium big coffee-colored head. smells milky, earthy, light yoghurt, spices, some licorice, light parfumy. decent smell. medium body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes lightly sweet, some licorice, earthy, light yoghurt, spices. finishes lightly sweet with notes of licorice, some yoghurt and spices. still ok, but seems to be rather old.

On tap at Cirkus, Stavanger. Pours black with a small head. Aroma of caramel, weak roast and new roasted coffee. Taste is moderate sweet, dark roasted malts, coffee. Soft carbonated. Lingering roast and coffee.

Opaque black with a nice head definition. The 1 finger head is light brown and creamy, lasting around 10-15 minutes, but making no legs. Flavors of coffee, chocolate, smoked salmon and bacon, faint molasses, herbal spices. Creamy light body with a strong intensity. Lacks a little freshness being dry and bitter, with a present sugary feel. Ends with an earthy smoked bacon aftertaste. A mix between a dry stout and a rauchbier. Overall decent craft: the flavors are nice but the feel is a little off, can be a little harsh, too oily and too thin.

22oz bottle. Dark brown colour with a small tan head. Roasted malts, cocoa, vanilla and coffee in the aroma. Average to soft carbonation and medium body. Taste is medium sweet, roasted and light bitter with chocolate and coffee notes. Overall, nice beer.

Noire dencre gros collet persistant. 
Aromes torréfiés chocolat café. 
Moyenne en bouche, finale assez amère mais relativement courte.
on tap scura buona discreta persistenzaschiuma spezia cioccolato amaro filo acidulo

22 oz bottle. Pours a dark brown with almost no head. Has a really nice hazelnut and cocoa chocolate. A little bready flavor and a bit of spices. Really nicely put together.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Nez: Chocolat, cigare
Bouche: Café, chocolat noir, vanille, fumée, liquoreuse, amertume en fin de bouche avec une sécheresse
Cest simple mais très bien fait.

On tap no bar Le Fine Mousse em Paris. ?5,5
Não eh meu estilo preferido. Preto profundo e espuma densa e duradoura. Sabor suave de café.
Black in color, but of a coffee start and dry finish, not my first choice but a pretty good Irish dry stout

Bottle. Near black in colour with medium carbonation. Aromas are of cocoa and espresso powder, vanilla, and pale malt. Well balanced on the palate between the dry/roasty (coffee and chalk) and the sweeter (vanilla and milk chocolate) elements. Even a little minty hop note shows up too. Complex and highly drinkable.
Bottle. Nearly-black pour with a tan head. Aroma is roasty, dark chocolate, a little creamy. Taste is rich and roasty, dark chocolate, a touch of coffee, fairly dry and bitter.
Dark body brown head nice lacing. Roasty nose. Taste of dark roasty malts, but not so complex. Quality dry stout but not something Id go out of my way to have.

Really enjoyed this one! First smell remainds me a bit of an old bar. Not that pleasent. But as you make your way down to the bottom of the glass, this stout becomes increasingly omforting. Its rounded warmth is a treat for the senses. At this low volume, an abslute favorite!

090116. A beer with a name that is difficult to pronounce but that is the only downside to this beer, not that this is even really a downside. I purchased this bottle from Cool Wine in Hobart a while ago and thought it was about time that I drank it.

The awesome looking label on the bottle certainly catches your eye and the label is both colourful and intriguing. While the outer packaging is very good it is the beer inside the bottle that really makes you sit up and take notice. 

Black as coal with a smooth even thin layer of tan foam and aromas of dark chocolate. Cocoa, vanilla and toffee fill the nose. This is a beer that is visually pleasing and from the first mouthful to the last you get nothing but great flavour.

Much like the aroma the flavour is all vanilla, toffee and dark chocolate. While the beer is thin in the mouth it is as smooth as velvet and fills the mouth with flavour and leaves a slightly bitter aftertaste.

Brune noire opaque, nez café léger, bouche plus forte en notes torrefiées, première bouche assez fluide et peu lourde, arrière bouche tendant sur lamère et pointe sèche. Pas fan du style et de lapparence qui va avec mais celle-ci est accessible.
Bouteille 60cl (format sympa) au joli packaging achetée chez Intercaves, Noisy-le-Grand, France, bue le 13/01/2016.
Had it couple months ago. I remember it had a medium beige head. I remember it tasted well but I wasnt marked by it as I was with other beers from that brewer. Still a very good brew.

Draught at Vices & Versa. Nice chocolate forward stout, round mouthfeel, herbal hops, notes of smoke and licorice, fairly dry finish. Solid stuff, could easily down a pint even without being a big stouthead.

Marrom escura, opaca. Espuma âmbar abundante de média duração. Aroma de malte torrado, com notas de café e baunilha. Sabor amargo equilibrado, com notas de café, chocolate, baunilha e um leve defumado. Retrogosto amargo com final adocicado.

Rating #1321. 11.11.2014. Bottle @sugarbowlcafe.Dark, black pour with a tan foam with decent retention. Aroma is very roasty, some cocoa, espresso. Taste is a hint of coffee, burnt sugar, finishes fairly dry. Quebecoisirlandais can be a word.

Dégustée en fût au Brouhaha. Un stout bien sombre à la mousse couleur blanc cassé, collante au verre et riche. De fortes arômes de café, dune juste torréfaction de grains entiers rôtis. Cest réconfortant, serré et corsé. Malgré le manque de complexité, ces arômes sont très réconfortantes et les bienvenues par cet après-midi gris de milieu de semaine. Malts modérés en bouche où la rondeur fait légèrement défaut à la texture. Une belle amertume de houblons légèrement résineux balance parfaitement la torréfaction qui demeure au premier plan. Texture soyeuse, lisse et souple, un autre très beau produit de notre brasserie de Shawinigan.

Black with a pale head. Aroma is anise, chocolate, fig, hint of coffee. Medium bodied, lightly oily mouthfeel, bittersweet on the palate with a lightly astringent finish. Taste is mild coffee, anise, fig, chocolate.

Very dark mahogany with a generous long lasting khaki head that laces well. Nose of coffee and grassy hops with chocolate and some light dark candied fruit. Light sweet candy underneath a moderate bitter espresso and chocolate and light licorice. Medium+ creamy mouth with a quite dry finish. Decent and balanced.

Bottle at home. Black with fizzy light brown head. Dark chocolate, fresh roasted coffee beans, dried plums, light peach and herbs. Quite fruity with nice chocolate notes, and very light on the roasted character. Medium sweet and light bitter. Medium bodied with slick feel. Very nice.

Medium, dense cream-beige head over pitch-black beer. Very nice & intriguing nose with stout features, aromatic herbs & flowers, rosewater, straw, immortelles, liquorice, roasted and sweet; Fascinating! Dry, roasted to burnt. Sweet and bitter(ish) chocolate. Roasted grains, black bread. Creamy MF, seemingly well-carbonated, but not very well-bodied, even slightly watery. Pleasing stout.

600ml bottled 06/2014, date exp.06/2015ish from Mondial de la Bière Mulhouse 2014. - does all it says on the label and promises as an Irish dry stout, with an unmistakeable New World hop freshness: bayleaf-spiked Wiener Nescafe, damp nettle and dried orange rind in aroma, more powdery bitter chocolate in taste, some milk chocolate cream and more bayleaf herbalistics joining hazelnut malts. Great mouthfeel and dryness, quite full for its abv, with few watery pockets. Nevertheless holds it own with genuine IRL Porterhouse Wrasslers Stout.

600ml bottle from Broue Ha Ha in Gatineau, Quebec. Near black in colour with a thin but lasting beige head, good lacing. The aroma is of dark malts, coffee, liquorice, smoke and chocolate. The flavour is lightly sweet, brown sugar, chocolate and coffee, some burnt malts, toasty. Sweet mouthfeel, medium/light body, medium carbonation. Finishes long, sweet and roasty. A vert nice and drinkable stout. Sweet and roasty.

Bottle 600ml. [ As Le Trou du Diable Sang-dEncre ].Clear dark red brown color with a large, frothy - creamy, good lacing, fully lasting, beige head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, roasted, chocolate, sweet malt, white - light chocolate. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a average to long duration, roasted, chocolate, dark malt, dry, wood - coffee, white - light chocolate. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20150620]
Tap at Moeder Lambic St Gilles. Surprisingly light. Cola element. Maybe a little fruity, bit spritzy. Light roast, little choc. Seems more carbonated than i would have expected,
Draft - Nice roasty notes. Jet black with a rich brown head. Dark bitter sweet roast and a odd almost sweet bitter sour note. Dry finish, but not enough to roast in the flavour.
bread, chocolate, black, brown foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, light body, oily feel, soft carbonation, light bitter, long finish,
Dark brown and clear. Has an off-white head. Roasted aroma with notes of smoke, dry texture, bitter finish.
Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Huge creamy head with excellent duration. Color is black. Aroma and taste are dry roast malt, chocolate, coffee, caramel and hops. Nice dry semi bitter finish.

Aroma is mild roasted notes, some toffee and mild creamy notes. Flavour is roasted malts, ashes, some toffee and a bit liquorice.
Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Almost black with a light brown head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt and coffee. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and roasted moderate bitter finish. 200615

Pours clear brown with two fat fingers of medium dense tan head, good retention, moderate lacing. (4/5) Nose is roasty malts, chocolate, coffee, herbal, slight smoke. (8/10) Taste is mild sweet, mild bitter. (8/10) Full creamy body, moderate to low carbonation, clean dry finish. (4/5)

Quite a nice dry Irish stout. Slightly smoky notes add an interesting complexity. Id really like to try this on tap (or nitro) - I bet it would set up a nicer head and creamier body. (16/20)
2015-06-03 - Stout noire au gout de café, de chocolat et de houblon. Lamertume assez présente laisse quand même un léger goût sucrée

More then 1 type of chocolate,cigarette/ash in a creamy dry stout.
Left the beer-1/2 way through- to answer the door(which took about 5 minute).The beer tasted "better" after being in the air for a bit- seemed to wake up.

Bottle from Mane Liquor. This would have to be one of the best examples of this style I have ever had. Incredible depth and balance. Loads of milk chocolate, mild coffee, earthy and slightly ashy but that burnt characteristic follows through to the bitter finish. A treat to drink
Ölföreningen 2015. Smak och doft kaffe, choklad, söt lakrits, rostade toner, soja och mörk torkad frukt. Murrig, rund och len, lagom sötma, fin karaktär och beska.

Nitro tap. Black with a light tan head that coats the glass. Aroma of chocolate-malt, vanilla, bitter coffee, grass, light roast, herbs.Thin, vaguely milky texture - if nitro gives the illusion of body its a pretty scrawny illusion here. Mocha and vanilla are there, but what sweetness there is is rather sugary. Very dry indeed at the end with a fair bit of bitterness and strong grassy and anise notes that linger. Didnt do much for me.

Notes of dark chocolate and espresso, with a hint of vanilla. Amazingly complex aroma. Slightly sweet. Pitch-black in the glass with a medium brown head. Pleasant bitterness. One of the best canadian beers I tried.

Il "sangue dinchiostro" del birrificio canadese Le Trou du Diable è una stout di quelle possenti. Ha un colore nerissimo e una schiuma molto persistente quasi marrone. Al naso è molto decisa, aroma di caffè e malto tostato. Assaggiandola i sapori del caffè e cioccolato sono accompagnati da una diffusa "secchezza" (infatti è classificata come dry stout), con quel gusto un po tendente al legno e al carbone tipico di queste stout così forti. Buona ma difficile possa piacere a tutti.

375ml bottle. Pours near black with a thin brown head. Slightly woody, some coffee notes, roasted malt, milk. Flavor has pleasant roastedness, light sweetness, milky notes. Finishes dry, slightly vinous and again, woody notes. Good body. Very tasty. Nice label.

Flaska från Saveur-bier drucken med ölföreningen. En stor stout med stora smaker trots låg alkholstyrka. Kaffe, choklad, hårdrostad malt men också söta smaker av russin, katrinplommon, lite soja. Rund, mjuk, lätt beska. Riktigt gott och stora smaker och stor kropp för den låga alkoholstyrkan.

Before rating this stout, I read a few of the other rater comments and wondered if I had the right beer. Looks like this one should be on tap to be truly enjoyed! Light malty aroma of roasted grains and mild coffee. I dont detect the hops. Creamy light brown mostly lasting head with fair lacing over a dark brown body. Light sweet initial flavor with a light bitter sweet average finish. Lively carbonation with a dry chalky palate. This was from a 600ml bottle., bottled on halloween 2014.

On tap at Vices & Versa. Pours a clear ruby tinged brown with a medium sized creamy tan head. Sweet roast and a touch of cocoa on the nose. Medium bodied, quite smooth. Roast, stewed fruits, chocolate, cocoa. Warm roast on the finish.
On tap @ Moeder Lambic. Quite light body, more watery than usual stouts. Not bad but too light for the style.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
From tap. Pours hazy dark briwn with a small brown head. Aroma is toasted abd caramelish. Bitter, fruity and toasted. Bitter, fruity and light toasted finish.

250 ml. draft @ Chez Moeder Lambiek Fontainas. Very dark tree brown / black, mocha bubbles. Nose is sweet watery chestnut, cheap chocolate, mocha. Taste is watery coffee, liquorish, thin coffee, cheap cacao, thin coffee, chestnut, Nearly flat & watery. Okay but pretty weak stuff overall.

Samples purloined from the soiled glass of Helsdon halfway through the Toronto Ratebeer Rollout session at the Only Cafe. Seems to hit all the right notes. Maybe a little closer to the London porter style. A tad sugary & a little waterd down.

Aroma is rich sweet malts, floral hops and some vanilla. Taste is medium rich mouth feel with slight raisin and vanilla tones. Light well balanced bitterness follows and finishes smoothly. Appearance is black with a thin pearl head that retains fairly well.

(Draught at Chez Moeder Lambic Fontainas, Brussels, 23 Oct 2014) Black colour with foamy, beige head. Malty, roasted nose with coffee, chocolate and a gentle touch of smoke. Malty, roasted taste with notes of coffee, cacao, dark bread, hints of smoke and a dry finish with a generous cacao bitterness. Medium body, quite dry. Well balanced and tasty stout. Nice one.

Deep dark brown coloured body with a touch of a violet and ruby tint when held up to the light, all with a two centimetre tall tan head. Aroma of roasted malt ,dry oatmeal, nuts, caramel, prunes and a bit more earth. Light-bodied; Strong roasted malt flavours with a dry grain and oatmeal note and some very light plums/prunes around as well. Aftertaste is relatively mild with only a handful of bitterness from the malt and a mostly sweet caramel and cereal flavour at the very end with nibs of chocolate as well. Overall, a very low-key and easy-drinking beer, still showing some good flavours and a nice body. I sampled this 600 mL bottle purchased from Marche des Sauveurs in Montreal, Quebec, Canada on 20-September-2014 for CA$6,00 sampled at home in Washington a few hours after returning from Belgium/The Netherlands and in need of a typical beer from the Americas - this delivered. Bottled on date (On back) of: 07-July-2014.

Probablement la meilleur dry stout au Québec. La version en fût au pub est de loin meilleur quen bouteille. On peut goûter le chocolat, le café, légère amertume, goût léger et très bien balancé. Le palais pour la version en fût avec de lazote est sublime, texture crémeuse et une finale effervescente. Lapparence est classique dune dry stout. Très bon produit pour stout à 5%.

Fotogén alkatú, szurokszínű kanadai főzet, a kategórián belül szinte festeni sem lehetne szebbet. Pörkölt dió, kakaópor és magas kakaótartalmú étcsokoládé illatát rejti, szépen megkomponált teste tejszerű pályát biztosít a pörkölvények játékának, hamus, fás és földes jegyek keverednek össze, elegánsan siklanak útjukon. Szárazsága a végletekig kihegyezett, lehullott levelek hangulatát rejtő végszavát élvezetes tartalom előzi meg. Bár a típus nem a mérhetetlen izgalmakat tartogató műfajok egyike, ez a főzet a kategória egy igen masszív és hibátlan darabja.

Bottle. Black body with a thick beige head. Aroma of coffee, roasted malt, smoke and some hops. Flavour of roasted malt and smoke. Medium bitter finish. Light body and high carbo. I think it´s too feezy to fully appreciate this beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Black, tan quick head. Mocca chocolate, soft roasty milky with wooden notes. Med light bodied, smooth nice soft bitters. Pretty nice porter/stout. Soft smooth nice flavour. Easy drink.-- bb

Handpump @Ma che siete venuti a fà (Rome). Pour black with a medium beige head. Nose: chocolate, some coffee, tobacco, smoke of cigarette, pungent and a bit hoppy. Flavour: light sweet at first, then balanced with bitter notes, chocolate, coffee, not so "dry" as I expected. Medium to light body, no carbonation. Nice.

341ml bottle poured into a pint glass around 6 degrees. Pours a fluid black robe of good opacity topped by two fingers of frothy tanned head. Carbonation is sublte, retention is good and lacing properties are very nice. The nose is subtle, more subtle than Im used to, but you still get the burnt toast, coffee beans and the grassy features, only they dont pack a punch. On the tongue, the brew is a bit aqueous and delivers subtle notes of ground coffee, cocoa and grass. The finish is abrupt and dry, respecting the style of this dry stout which leaves your palate with a touch of licorice. Overall this stout is ok, but I think a bit more corpus and aroma would make it outstanding.

75cl bottle from Grand Cru, Rimini. It pours a dark brown color with a small beige head. Aroma is toasted bread, dark chocolate, resin and earth Taste is roasty and medium sweet, before a lightly tangy dry finish. Notes of dry cocoa powder, espresso and lactose. Medium bodied with soft carbonation. Overall, ok stout

UPDATED: NOV 24, 2015 Scuro color cola con pannoso velo di schiuma beige. Al naso si avvertono quasi esclusivamente cacao in polvere ed espresso mentre di gusto è leggermente più complessa con note di cioccolato amaro, melasso, malto e fondi di caffè. Corpo medio, struttura setosa, finale amarognolo.

Black colour, small beige head. Aroma of chocolate, light spices, chocolate. Flavour roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, malt, liquorice. Sweet finish, chocolate. (from 60cL bottle @ ZZT IX, Oirschot. Thanks for sharing, Ansjelaah!)
On tap at Bishops Arms in Örebro. Roasted smell with dark malts, chocolate and coffee. Similar taste. Nice sweet malt base. Full body. Some fruits.

Pour is jet black with two fingers of tan head; great lacing. 
Nose is lots of cocoa, a bit of chocolate and roasted grain. Taste follows with a lingering bitter cocoa and coffee finish. Nice stuff, but a bit watery.
Draft at Ale House. Pours coca cola brown with a little beige head. Aroma is mild roasted malt. Very dry, thin. Some dark bread, coffee flavors.

Noire avec une mousse chocolat au lait abondante et laissant une intense dentelle sur le verre. Nez de café et de chocolat, fruits secs. Bouche ronde, corps crémeux, carbonation importante, belle amertume, saveurs de café et légèrement herbacées. Belle bière !
Poured from 600 ml bottle. Aroma of coffee and chocolate. Pours almost black with tan head. Has a light bitter taste. Full bodied and a creamy texture. A nice smooth stout.

Draft at Moeder Lambic Fontainas. Pours near black with a big beige head. Aroma of chocolate, cocoa, lactose, toffee, fudge, roast and licorice. Flavour is light moderate sweet and over moderate bitter. Light medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Keg at SBWF.  Hazy verydark brown, tan head. Chocolate and tobacco dominate the nose. Dryish with medium body and soft mouthfeel. Heavily roasted coffee, mud cake and black pepper before a mid bitter finish. Harmonious.

On tap @ Moeder Lambic, Brussels - BE. Color: opaque black beer with no carbonation and small brown head. Smell: roasted malt and some coffee notes but not so presence. Taste: malty dominate but not so extreme. Easy drinkable. Aftertaste: malty notes and water sensation.
Bottle shared @ZZT 9 Brown till black color with a beige head. Smells like al typical stout, coffee, roasty, sweet, chocolate. Tastes roasty, watery and a bit drop. .
Sample at Atlantic Beer Festival Moncton. Clear deep maroon color, small tan and beige head. Aroma of cocoa and coffee grounds. Taste has soft roast and bitter cocoa.

quite dense beige head leaves structured lacing. coffee coloured. aroma of leather, toffee, bit musky. taste like aroma, liquorice with a fair bitter aftertaste. quite thin mouthfeel, medium carbonation. bottle 37,5cl

Bouteille. Moustache Blanche. Robe noire, mousse écrue crémeuse. Nez léger de malt torréfié et de chocolat noir. En bouche on retrouve les aromes du nez avec des notes de grain de café grillé, de sucre brun et dépices. Finale sèche mais peu amère. Une stout de bonne facture.
Bottle thanks to Kevin. Pours dark brown tan head. Nose/taste of dark roast chocolate, toasted coffee, milk sugar, treacle, briny oyster, lightly burnt toast. Medium body. Dry finish.

600 ml bottle. Pours a dark brown, almost black colour with a small head. Aroma of roasted malts, cream, chocolate and coffee. Flavour of roasted malts, cream, white bread, coffee and chocolate. Light bodied and soft carbonation. Nice.

60 cl bottle.
Pours dark ruby red color with a small head. Aroma is nice and roasty, cocoa, dark chocolate and dried fruits. Fruity and malty flavor, some cocoa, dark chocolate notes and wood. Nice but a bit watery.
3325

60 cl bottle @ olio, bottled 01.11.2013
Aroma has cocoa, vanilla and sweet chocolate tones. Flavour is somewhat dry with deep roasted tones, cocoa, English hops and hints of ash. Nice.

600ml bottle

Pours pitch black with a smooth brown head. Aroma of roasted malts, coffee beans, cocoa, dark chocolate and vanilla. Taste is watery, slightly roasty with hints of coffee, dark chocolate and cocoa beans. Finish is smooth and dry with some roastiness and dark chocolate. A bit light bodied.

Now the problem with blood ink, see, is that shes rare. You have to find and slaughter a dirty ol giant squid, wring that fuckers life out of it, to get that sweet inky nectar. Luckily a brasserie Quebecois has managed to find a method to ensnare these vicious fiends and bottle their drained blood for us less ballsy types. A nice big oily mocha monster with hints of burnt bread and smoke. It beats dying to death by squid tentacles.
On tap at La fira del poblenou. Black colour with tan head. Roasted, coffee aroma. Sweet, roasted, smoked, coffee taste. Medium body.

Fun bottle with fun labels and font. Poured black with a small tan head. Aroma was of nuts, coffee, roasted malts, and chocolate. Tasted of big coffee, dark chocolate, and roasted malts. Had an oily low carbonation porter like body, which I really enjoyed. Aftertaste was all black coffee. This was a great brewsky.
Mild smokey aroma, dark brown colour with a well laced short lasting head. Pleasant taste of coffee and smoke. Watery feel with a smokey palate.

Smoky smooth stout from Quebec. Watery but almost whiskey like after taste. Enjoyable

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Bought due to the cool label. Poured a dark brown color with a larger sized off white head. Chocolate, roast, caramel, and lighter coffee.

Botella de 37,5 cl en el lúpulo en el momento el 14-06-2014. Elaborada en 30-07-2013 hasta 30-07-2014. Color negro intenso con espuma beige. Aromas suaves de maltas ligeramente tostadas y dulces de caramelos también tostados. Cuerpo ligero a medio con 5.5 vol fácil de beber. Sabores ligeros, algo pastosos, de maltas tostadas algo especiadas, ligeros cacaos y chocolates . Regusto amargo poco intenso y con toques de cafés quemados y achicorias que se intensifican según va calentando . Ligera y fácil de beber. No esta mal.
Noir sombre avec une mousse moka. Larôme du malt torréfié, chocolat et café. Le goût est pareille avec un très peu damertume. Doux en bouche.

Draught at St. Augustines, VancouverDark brown color, near black, with compact head. The aroma is mild, but with nice notes of roasted malt and coffee. Lean body, the mouthfeel is rather dry; good roasted malt flavor, with a light coffee edge; there is some minimal sourness from the dark malts, while the final shows some more dark chocolate; strong bitterness, with some hop resins hidden by the roastiness.Balanced, well brewed.

Bottle to pint glass
Aroma of chocolate, molasses, toffee, roasted malt, and a touch of yeast. Colour is black with a 3 cm frothy and creamy tan head that quickly reduces to 1 cm leavining thick frothy lacing. Taste is dark chocolate, coffee, cherry, nutmeg, and ending with a smooth balanced bitter sweetness.
600ml bottle. Really nice, mellow stout. Smooth chocolate flavour. Creamy body. Overall, very good.

600 ml bottle. Black beer with a thin brown head. Aroma of roasted malt, dark chocolate and coffee. Sweet flavour of roasted malt, chocolate, caramel, coffee and a hint of licorice. Medium body with a creamy texture and soft carbonation. Very tasty.

600ml bottle into an English pint. Pours nearly black with a lasting tan head. Nose of coffee, caramel, and a bit of dark chocolate. A bit roasty, with a bit of dry bitterness. Creamy on the palate. Interesting.

On tap at the Paris International Beer Celebration festival during the 1FRBG

Dark brown beer. Aromas are light (easy to drink), aroma of burnt coffee.
Good discovery

Almost black bodied, stable head, looks okay. Light toasted and roasted coffee, plus a good amount of cereal. Not super dark. Dry body, well developed, only lightly hopped. Good bitterness though. Decent and certianly characterful with its very dry ending. (On tap at the Paris International Beer Celebration festival during the 1FRBG)
bootle. moderate dryness. pleasant milky creamy roast. bit of a creamy roasty coffee presence. bit of grainy cocoa. drinks fine.

Au fût @ML Fontainas. Bière brune au corps assez dense au col épais qui offre un nez ample épicé avec des effluves de fumé, dorge grillé, de levure, de tire derable. En bouche, les saveurs fumées et grillées sestompent assez vite au profit de saveurs épicée et sucrée de la tire derable. Le corps malté robuste développe des arôme de cacao. La fin est presque pas amère: seulement quelque notes aigres En fait, le sucre se marie bien au torréfié ; lun complétant lautre, je trouve cette bière assez onctueuse, voire capiteuse (le palais est gras mais la langue rêche) mais sans lourdeur. Je suis resté longtemps avec ce goût épicé du sirop dérable dans la bouche. Bien.
Bottle @la fine mousse. A dark beer with huge head. Dark chocolate malt notes, dry, long roasted aftertatste, medium creamy to oily, smoked finish, some astringency, bit disappointed.

Deep brown,loose tan head.Roasty nose,cacao notes.Metallic dry roast palate.Med bitterness in finish.Drinkable, but boring, lacks body
Disappointing

Bottle from Bieres du Monde. Pours midnight black, khaki head, horizontal lines of lace. Smells lie a brown ale, quite malty, touch of smoke. Tastes rather light, bitter. Thin but chalky. Not quite what I expect in a stout.
Deep brown, fairly thin pour. Aroma of coffee, fruity, ash...dust? Taste is quite easy drinking, roasty, light coffee, dried fruits. Decent.

Enbouteillée le 30 juillet 2013. Noire, opaque, avec un épais collet de mousse couleur moka, effervescente. Nez torréfié de café et chocolat, danis et de pâte à biscuits. Goût encore torréfié de café et chocolat noir. En bouche, une sensation aqueuse vient sintroduire dans la gorgée, au milieu du côté torréfié des grains et de la finale sèche et amère.
Bottle @ ZZT 9 shared by ansjelaah. Almost black colour with a small sized beige head. Smells coffee, roasty, sweet, chocolate. Tastes roasty, bitter, iron, watery, salmiak. Thin body, soft carbo.

Ins Glas ergießt sich ein sehr sehr dunkles rötlichbraunes Bier mit schöner beigen Schaumkrone. Geruch sehr angenehm nach Kaffee und Schokolade, minimal rauchig. Geschmack schokoladig, leicht trocken, dunkle Früchte, Kaffee.
Bottled @ ZZT 9, small sample. Clear dark redbrown color, short frothy brown head. Aroma of roasted malts, blackcurrant, lots of licorice. Bit sweet, bit malty bitterness.
Bottle @ ZZT 9 thanks to Ansjelaah. Dark brown color, small off-white to beige head. Smell and taste malts, liquorice, decently bitter, brown sugar. Decent body and carbonation.
Pours a dark brown cola ish beer with a good white head. Smells chocolate, coffee, roasted. Tastes metal, licorice, chocolate. Average carbo, medium body and a sticky texture.

Noire avec un léger collet blanc. Nez intense de café. Herbacé. Quasi poivrée. Caramel brûlé. Bouche: facile à boire. Café/vanille. Léger sucre tout au long jusqu'à une finale légèrement amère. Bien fait.
Pours black with a thin light head. Aroma is mostly dark fruit. Flavor is licoricey with dark fruit. Hints of coffee and chocolate in the finish. Overall a good beer

Lasting frothy off-white head atop an opaque black body. Nose of deep roasted malt and butter. Palate is thin and this is very light. Decent flavour but "epic stout" is a stretch. Mild jerky, coffee and ash. Decent but likely the biggest Trou du Diable disappointment Ive had so far.

750mL bottle, pours deep dark brown with a small beige head. Aroma of dry roast, oats and bitter cocoa. Flavour is exactly the same - rather bland - with notes of dry roast and bitter cocoa. Decent beer, but leaves much to be desired.

It pours mahogany with ruby highlights (almost opaque); the head is mocha-coloured and mousse-like. The aroma has notes of: toffee, raisins, chocolate, cracker, and coffee. The taste is medium dry that finishes medium bitter; there are notes of: cracker, coffee, toffee, anise, and grapefruit-pith. The palate is medium bodied, has light carbonation, is oily, and has a long bitter finish. Overall, a fairly decent stout, especially for being so low in alcohol.
Bu en pression de 33cl, couleur noire avec une jolie mousse brunâtre, grosse attaque sur le sarrazin en bouche et le café, pour finir sur du caramel très intéressante.

The thinning choco head leaves light lacing. The nose is of roasted cocoa. Lots of roasted malt with ample bitter balancing, the chocolate shows up in the essence of the finish. A bit on the drier side, it is bold and active on the palate. Decent chocolate stout thats well-integrated.
600 ml bottle. Pours a dark brown with full head. Aromas of burnt black coffee and dark chocolate. Dry but not much flavor other than watery black coffee. A session stout...
Bue à la pression. Belle couleur noire, mousse brune. Café et chocolat au nez et en bouche. Faible corpulence due au manque dalcool. Finale sèche.
Fruchtig malziger, ziemlich trockener Antrunk. Zu trocken im Mittelteil, mittelstark aromatisch. Leicht würziger Nachhall, minimal hopfig. 11/9/9/10/11/11

600ml bottle. Black colour with huge, thick, creamy, fairly lasting, moderately lacing, tan head. Roasty dark malty aroma, a herbal spicy touch, hints of grainy coffee surrogat. Taste is dry, roasty dark malty, hints of mocha, a nuttily touch, also a herbal touch somewhere between mint and aniseed; very subtle sweetness; soft palate. Nice, but cant arouse real enthusiasm.

600ml bottle. Pours black with a brown edge, and a thin cocoa coloured head that disappeared quickly. Cold coffee notes dominate the nose, with light citrus, and light roasty malt notes. Suprisingly dry, with a metallic bitterness up front that sticks around until the finish, coffee, light smoke, earthy notes, very light dates, and an almost grassy note in the VERY dry finish. There are parts of it I like, but its not my preferred stout style.

12fl oz bottle. Courtesy of Andrés Lúpulo.
In ahort: a dry dry stout.
Pours black with nice off white head, some head retention, poor lacing. Roasty, chickory, some cooked vegetables aromas. Medium body, soft carbonation, oily texture. Taste is roasty, quite dry, coffee. Dry aftertaste.

Color negro con reflejos rojizos y espuma de un beige claro muy abundante y densa. Aromas de cereales tostados con una intensidad moderada. En boca tiene una densidad media y un final seco y tostado de un amargor equilibrado. Rica y buena representante de su estilo.

600ml bottle. Black with a foamy beige head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate and earthy hops. Taste is roasted malts, coffee, dark chocolate and earthy hops. Medium body, soft carbonation, creamy texture. Dry roasty finish.

Tap. Moderate toasted and bitter chocolate for the malt, light resin and earth for the hops and yeast, with mineral notes in the background. Head is large, creamy, light tan, with excellent full coverage lacing and is fully lasting. Color is very dark brown with a red tint. Flavor starts lightly acidic, then finishes lightly acidic and lightly to moderately bitter. Palate is medium, creamy with a soft carbonation and a lightly dry finish. Nothing over the top but a good easy drinking Dry Stout.

375ml from the olds on a cruise, shared at home with the Mrs. Good choice mind you! Loving the giant squid artwork. Dark brown pour, good cream-coloured head and nice lacing. Aromas are herbal and roasted coffee, the coffee coming through more as it opens up. Taste is a little buttery, disappointingly, malt more than hops, and not enough roast coffee. Finishes a bit cloying. Very glad to have tried it though.

375 mL bottle from the LCBO, served in an English pint. Pours black with a large tan head that fades slowly to a thin remnant and leaves a trace of lace. The nose has big notes of roasted malts, herbal hops, earth and a touch of smoke. The flavour is fairly dry with roasted malts in the forefront, smoke, and herbal hops. The hops pick up through the second half, imparting an herbal spiciness with a slight piney quality. The finish is long, roasty and hoppy in equal parts. On the palate it is medium in body with a milky texture and average carbonation. Overall, this is a nice dry stout with smokey, roasted malts and a nice complement of herbal hops. The smoke might be a bit too much for me, but it is overall very well put together. 2013-10-05

Pours a motor oil black with a thin sticky beige head that leaves behind nice lacing. The aroma is thin, coffee, bitter chocolate, roasty malts. The flavour follows suit, dry bitter burnt coffe note trails into the finish. Meh, its alright, gets some bonus points for being a little different than your average stout.

Bottle, shared with a bunch of folks at a Christmas party. Dark brown with a light brown head. Nice roast character of coffee and chocolate without feeling overly heavy. Walnut dryness in the finish. Solid.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: 375ml bottle. Dark brown body, small mocha head, ok retention. Aroma of roasted malt, licorice, smoked prunes, ash. Taste of smoked prunes, roasted to burned malt, hints of coffee, some sour notes, herbs. Light and enjoyable.

375ml bottle from the LCBO.
Pours a nearly black brown with a three finger, mocha/tan head that thins itself out moderately quickly. 
Aroma is faint with notes of roasted malt, burnt coffee, and very slight, bitter chocolate.
Taste is bitter with a dry, roasted malt, slightly coffee aftertaste. 
Medium body and carbonation. Fairly clean in the mouth with a slightly creamy texture. Certainly drinkable.
Overall good but not my thing. I thought Id give this a try but I enjoy more of the chocolaty/sweet stouts and this just isnt doing it for me. A bit too bitter without enough other flavours to mix it up. Probably wouldnt buy again but a good brew if you enjoy the style.

coffee burned grain, nice apperance black with big bubbly head. well equilibrated, nice bitterness at the end.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Couleur oire avec un beau col blanc. Nez de malt grillé et de chocolat. En bouche malt chocolat et légèrement café, trop rafraîchissante pour une stout pas assez damertume et de caractère. Bonne bière malgré tout.
Bottle from LCBO. Black with a huge foamy tan head. Aroma: roasty, creamy, light berry notes. Creamy roasty taste with coffee, and a dry finish. Smooth mouthfeel. Nice.

2013/10/26 - Pours a dark brown/black colour, with a thick and frothy tan coloured head that reduces quickly to a surface film. Aroma is coffee, cocoa, nuts and roasted malts. Taste is very similar to nose with a mildly bitter finish. Mouthfeel is medium and smooth with lively carbonation and a slightly drying finish.



---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
cask. Black/brown colour, small foamy head. Coffee and roast. Light, smooth. Pretty good.

Pours a clear dark drown with ruby tones when held to the light - 1 inch tan cap dissipates soon but laces moderately. Aroma is light when chilled but as it warms you get light roastyness and some sweet malts, very understated aroma for a stout. Flavour is mild but rounded with good mouth feel and a medium body - Malt forward front side roasty lightly sweet - finishes with a bit more bittering - pleasant but has a London porter character - not what I look for in a stout.

Pours an opaque black with a robust and creamy mocha head. Aroma notes include chocolate, espresso, vanilla, and tootsie rolls. Tasting notes include chocolate, coffee, dark roasted malts upfront. The middle is a tad watery and metallic, but is made up for with a dry finish that is slightly bitter.

Excellent!

On cask at Beaus Oktoberfest. Sweet grain and mocha aroma. Hazy dark brown under some white bubbles. Assertive bitterness combined with mocha and some earthy hops that are sort of spicy and with medium bitterness. Medium body, medium carbonation, slightly bitter finish.

375 mL bottle. Pours opaque black with a splotchy beige-brown head. Dark molasses, coffee, cocoa, dark bread and earthy hop notes. Dry and layered with notes of licorice and roast. Moderate to full bodied with lively carbonation; slightly sticky. Need more stouts this good to be readily available.
Tap at wvrst, dark pour, roasty smell and taste, really nice roasty taste, and it has a nice dryness and it a really nice stout

(bottle) clear very dark brown with a very tall brown head; aromas of roast, biscuit, smoked fruit; silky smooth palate; dry, clean flavour with long light bitter finish; very nice (wonderful label too!)
Pours dark brown with a finger of tan head. Aroma is roasty and smoky. Taste is bitter chocolate with a bitter piny finish.

Appearance: Bonus point for the absolutely beautiful label! Pours a nice inky chocolate black with a nice thin brown head.

Aroma: Roast, bread, coffee, chocolate. With a richness of aroma not unlike a brownie! In fact this is pretty much what Id expect a coffee flavored brownie to smell like. 

Taste: Sweet and creamy with a lightly chocolate taste that gradually fades to a long coffee finish. Surprisingly restrained for a beer of such deep colour and body. A little bit of minerality. Good, but not great. 

Palate: Smooth and creamy with an attractive fizz on the lips that fades quickly. The lingering finish on the mid-tongue doesnt touch much fo the roof of the mouth at all. Not a lot of character here, but pleasant. 

Overall: This is a powerful and quality offering in the stout department, and will satisfy you utterly. While not quite world-class, it definitely doesnt fall short, and Id happily drink this again.
couleur noir avec léger col de mousse brunâtre.Arôme de café et cacao.En bouche latorréfaction de café est immédiatement apparente pour laissé ensuite la place a un côté cémeux et moka.

Couleur noire foncé, mousse fine et crémeuse, brune comme le créma de mon expresso, laisse peu de trace sur le verre. Peu de bulles et pétille doucement sur la langue. Douce odeur boisé. Un goût de café vient en premier pour laisser la place à un goût plus boisé. Entre les deux, une petite amertume apparait avec le goût de cacao. Assez épaisse et huileuse.

Pours a very dark blackish brown with a large light brown rocky head leaving lots of lace up the glass. Aroma is roasted malts, coffee notes, mild sweetness and cocoa. Flavour is coffee, roasted malts(adds to the bitterness) mild-med bitterness from hops and grain, moderate sweetness, cocoa and a nice dry finish. Excellent dry stout, definitely would recommend!

Thanks to cfrancis for this. Pours an almost opaque black with a red tinge and a nice frothy brown head like crema on an espresso shot. Aroma of roasted malts, vanilla, wood and chocolate. Taste is roasted malts, vanilla, chocolate, wood and then a nice light bitterness on the finish. Finish dry with a medium low carbonation. Excellent dry stout.

On nitro tap at Vices et Versa. Pours black with a very thick light tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, lactose, chocolate. Flavor of sweet roasted malt, sweet milk, bitter chocolate, with a dry, charred malt finish. Smooth, dry, very good.
7/4/8/4/15 (3.8/5)

Draft. Medium tan head atop black body with brown edge. Aroma is moderately sweet, anise, some caramel, milk chocolate. Taste is moderately sweet, chococaramel, some roast. Medium body, some creaminess, low carbonation.

Bouteille de 600ml. 5,99$ chez Saucisserie BDF. La bouteille a elle seule vaut probablement le prix, très belle bouteille pour les collectionneurs! Odeur de café, chocolat et légèrement boisé. Beau visuel, stout très foncé avec une onctueuse et délicieuse mousse couleur café crème. En bouche le café et le malt dominent puis disparaissent rapidement pour laisser place à un arrière-gout très houblonné, boisé, légèrement fumé. La bière est crémeuse, peu deffervescence, cest comme boire un café au lait. Bon produit en général, à essayer pour comparer avec une Stout plus traditionnelle .

Dark brown pour with a small, tan head. Aroma is woody with some chocolate notes. It has a somewhat light body with creamy texture and average carbonation. The taste mildly sweet, while at the same time lightly roasted and dry.

Aroma comes off as very smoky, almost charcoal rather than smoke. Appearance is black, a little bubbly but not much head. No lace. Great malt aroma and flavour, very smoky. Palate is kind of thin. Tried this with some really dark chocolate and was disappointed as the chocolate really dominated, rather than complemented the beer. Nice for a try.
Deep dark pour, almost black in colour. Great tan frothy head and clinging lace. Chocolate malt aroma. Lovely flavour of coffee, coffee and chocolate malt. Crisp finish yet a little sweet overall.

Nitro @ Delirium.
Brune foncée - noire, col crémeux tenant bien au verre de couleur moka.
Arôme est malté grillé/café moyen le tout suivi dun houblonné subtile en rétro nasal.
Palais présente un profil malté dominant et profond ponctué par une pointe danis par un suivi chocolaté-grillé et café. Le tout reste bien léger avec une effervescence modérée et toujours cette fin de bouche anisé presque réglisse sur un côté café au lait. Reste sèche avec une amertume plus en retrait qui confère une pointe damertume citronnée qui ajoute une dimension agréable aux divers malts.

TAP at Delirium cafe Brussels. Shared with Mathieu87. 
APPEARANCE: black beer, small unstable beige head.
NOSE: coffee, chocolate, little hoppy, little like a red ale, little fruity.
TASTE: chocolate, not much taste in total, very watery, bitter aftertaste, little red fruits.
Jai bien aimé cette bière. Elle est dun beau noir persistant et son goût de café fumé légèrement chocolaté est excellent.

Pours a one hundred percent purely opaque black with a glistening beige head. The nose has a robust dry roasted mocha and chocolate note with big nutty and roasted malt notes. Dry and bitter stout flavour with a hint of earthen woody vanilla. Very dry aftertaste with a smack of robust smoky roast

On tap at Bellwoods. Pours a dark brown with modest tan head. Aroma is roasty coffee and light fruitiness. Flavour dominated by roasty coffee with gentle dark fruit and some herbal character. Lightly dry finish. Solid.

600ml bottle pours black in color with a 2 finger light brown head that retains well and leaves some excellent lacing on the glass.  Aroma is mild chocolate and coffee.  Taste is a bold roasted grain and coffee bitterness with a chocolate malty sweetness underneath.  Medium bodied with ample carbonation.  A very well done stout that I highly recommend due to its complexity.

tan coloured head and jet black colour. Classic stout aroma with chocolate and roast and some coffee ground. Medium bodied brew with some roast bitterness, some choclate and dry beer with a slightly acidic note. Easy to drink a few of these.

UPDATED: SEP 12, 2013 Bière noire qui laisse filtrer des reflets rouges à la lumière, surmontée dun col brunâtre un peu mince, mais résistant. Ce nest pas facile à observer, mais leffervescence semble moyenne, et le liquide semble parfaitement limpide. Arômes de malt torréfié (café et chocolat), de malt fumé et de houblon herbacé, avec certaines effluves plus cendrés, herbes brûlés, voire cigarette. En bouche, cest bien pétillant, mais lonctuosité est très décevante pour le style. Au goût, le houblon herbacé me semble dominant (ce qui est anormal pour le style je crois), et cest rapidement suivi dune amertume de faible à modérée mais bien présente, et même dune certaine acidité rappelant le citron. Le malt est bien trop timide au goût, à peine quelques pointes de café et de fumée sont-elles perceptibles. Ce nest pas une mauvaise bière, mais cest très atypique comme stout, et lamateur de stout en moi la trouve un peu décevante.
Decent stout. Pours black with nice head and lacing. Dry roast malt aroma with some nut. Texture slightly watery. Finishes a little bitter and sour. Carbonation pretty light. Tap at volos.

On tap at Volo.  Pours black with a thick brown head.  Looks like nitro.  Bitter nuts and coffeeun the nose.  The flavour is sweeter, with nuts again, but more chocolate than coffee.  On the thin side, but thats fairly typical.  Not as much roast bitterness as some.  Still miles ahead of Guinness.

Pours black with a small white head.  Aroma is roasted malts, bitter chocolate and grass.  Taste is dry bitter dark chocolate, roasted malts and grassy undertones with a small hop presence.  Nice dry stout.

600ml bottle. Black with mountains of tan head that leaves globs of lace. Coffee dominates the nose with a noticeable herbaceous and smoky note. The same things can be said of the palate. Tasty and easy going.

600 ml bottle from les arpents Verts. A: Coffee, bitter chocolate App: pitch black with lasting beige head. T/p: full body finish is bitter and long. It has a velvety texture. O: great. Truly enjoyed it. Balanced .the texture is remarkable. Sexy bottle and label.

Bière blonde de 5.5% dalcool. Elle possède un odorat sucré. Elle possède un beau col au versement. Il y a une amertume en bouche, du type amertume de café noir. Après plusieurs gorgées, on goûte le sarrasin. Elle est âcre et intéressante en finale.

Bouteille 600ml. Couleur noire opaque, mousse moka aérienne laissant une dentelle éparse. Arôme de malt torréfié, chocolat noir, café. Goût de malt torréfié, légère acidité, amertume en fin de bouche, chocolat en arrière-goût. Carbonation très faible, corps faible, aqueuse. Bonne buvabilité.

Thanks to Ian for this one (I think), 500ml bottle. Dark brown with a mocha head. Roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, quite dry. Moderate body and carbonation, slightly bitter, quite dry and nicely mild.

Very slight coffee aroma almost unnoticeable. Almost absent nose.
Visual is opaque black, with generous rocky and foamy head lasting for several minutes. Very thick and dense head sticking on glass marvelously, leaving a wonderful lacing. A piece of art.
Attack is mostly coffee and black chocolate with a strong bitterness as finish. Mouth feel is very dry, with notes of roasted grains and a slight touch of smoke. Floral hops are developing notes of conifer helping balancing coffee bitterness finish. With its watery texture and its thin body, this beer is more malty (roasted) than hoppy and is more into coffee bitterness.

Noire profonde, jolie mousse persistante.
Nez levuré, sucre laiteux comme une milk stout.
En bouche, arômes de noisette et noix brûlées. Moins persistante qu?en fut, on dirait...!

Bouteille de 600ml qui arbore une superbe étiquette, la pieuvre est réussie. La robe est classique pour un stout épique soit noire avec une mousse beige. Le nez est simple avec évidemment du chocolat, des grains rôtis. En bouche le liquide est simple, du grain rôti et grillé, du chocolat et une touche damertume. Finale un peu sucrée ce qui déplait.

Noire opaque coiffée dune mousse beige, dense et durable. Une dentelle se dessine lorsquelle se résorbe. Un nez quon tente de séduire par des effluves de torréfaction, parfumé par du persil en flocons. En bouche, cest acidulé, avec de légères pointes épicées à loccasion. Sinon, cest amer par la bande et ça ne flâne pas sitôt la traversée du gosier effectuée. Cest velouté, cest doux, cest timide et ce, tout en étant agréable. (604-190413)

500 ml bottle courtesy of Tommy, thanks buddy! Pours thick black loads of Guinness like head. Not a lot going with on with the smell a bit of coffee. The taste is quite smooth, with mild carbonation and bitter sweet aftertaste. A very drinkable beer and one that I could consume a lot of!

500 ml bottle from Broue Ha Ha, served at cellar temperature in a tulip glass. 
App.:  Deep brown-black with a full mocha head.
  
Aroma:  Very dry and roasted, stark and slightly tangy grape-like fruitiness, a touch brothy/briny, also a touch metallic, neat label, certainly a Dry Stout.
  
Palate:  Medium+ body, very relaxed, loose effervescence.
  
Flav.:  Lots of roasted malts, some chocolate and coffee notes, lightly earthy, a little treacle and molasses, a little grape-like fruitiness, pretty nice for a Dry Stout; dry with fair bitterness and a stark, roasted malt finish.

Nice label and a good example of the style.

Pours pitch black with a thin tan head that leaves some legs, quite good looking. Aroma is mostly of roasted malt. Taste is dry (good!) with not much apparent bitterness except maybe a little from the roasted malt. Mouthfeel is good with a medium level of carbonation. Overall a good but not standout TDD product.

A nice basic stout. Pours cola black with a hint of ruby when put to light. Nice tan fog head that sticks around and lots of lacing. Nose is espresso and some cocoa. Aromas are similar with additions of some roasted malt, and some metal. Tastes are medium sweet and medium bitterness. Body is pretty light for style with lively carbonation. This is an easy drinker, nothing to blow you away but one I could easily come back to.

Pours dark with some ruby highlights, topped by a bubbly tan head which recedes to yield nice lacing around the glass.  Pleasant roasted aroma, notes of coffee beans and a touch of smoke is also discernible.  In the mouth, bitter hop notes collide with ashy roasted malts; gradually fades into a lingering dry finish but leaves little room for other elements of the brew to be expressed.  Light and almost airy on the palate, makes for easy drinking.  Overall, an enjoyable stout but perhaps a bit too much on the subtle side.

Bottle - 600ml. Pours an opaque black body with low carbonation and a thick beige foamy head. Well balanced malty aroma with hoppy, oaky, coffeeish, and grainy hints. Its robust malty/hoppy taste carries roasted coffee and some subtle smokey notes. Ends with a long, dry, bitter/roasty finish. Very well done.

Le liquide est noir comme la nuit dans les bois,sa mousse est beige,son col épais et sa dentelle sagrippe aux parois de mon verre.Au nez cest le café noir,le chocolat noir,le rôtis et le fumé.Au goût,( la texture est plutôt huileuse),le café noir avec une très légère amertume et une final malté-rôtis.
Premiere fois que je suis décu dune bière venant du trou du diable, il ny a rien a dire, CEST PLATE. mince et  sans profondeur. Juste poche

(version 5.5% en bouteille de 600 ml) - Un bon col de mousse moka coiffe cette bière dun noir pur. Nez de cacao, de café, de réglisse noire et de biscuits danois. En bouche, cest vraiment lamertume et le côté corsé-cendré du grain torréfié qui mène la danse. La bière est très pétillante en entrée. La finale est sèche, mais un voile sucré demeure perceptible sur les papilles en rappel.
Belle couleur, mousse qui se tient bien, le nez est moins intéressant que la bouche.

Ouvrir une Trou du Diable est toujours un petit événement en soi, et quand on débute la dégustation de la Sang dencre, on reste un peu surpris : un stout discret, pétillant, un brin aqueux avec des notes darachides en plus des céréales torréfiées. Une fois le premier choc passé, on se prend à lapprécier pour ce quelle est : une bière régulière faite par une grande brasserie. Elle prend du corps en réchauffant, et si sa minceur déçoit toujours un peu encore vers la fin, elle est tout de même délicieuse, audacieuse et très réussie.

Un verre au Saint-Bock.  Une tenue exemplaire.  Une robe noire et une dentelle qui sinstalle comme un rideau.  Un nez de grains brûlés.  Une fumée latente ou les hallucinations de malts fortement rôtis.  Une très mince douceur.  Du chocolat qui nest pas sucré.  Des saveurs foncées, portées vers la torréfaction.  Des notes chocolatées qui sadoucissent sur ma langue.  Une bouche très confortable.  Un corps embelli par linjection du CO2.  Une texture crémeuse à souhait.  Une finale qui permet la rencontre de houblons et de notes amères qui proviennent du conditionnement des grains.  Finalement, une proposition facile à boire et très honnête.

UPDATED: SEP 30, 2007 Any first impressions?
-A lofty nitro head duly sits upon the opaque blackness.
-Tiramisu icing and chocolate are dispersed by the malt profile.
-Coffee bean roastiness, molasses sweetness and cocoa are found, rendering more complexity.
-The body is creamy and full now; a great improvement of what it was when first brewed.

What if you dig deeper?
-This recipe has matured greatly since its first Guinness-like attempts..
-Fruity esters accentuate the pleasure.
-The finish is balanced and quite pleasant.
-The result is now a chewy quencher, highly enjoyable for the stout lover.
